intro: Plectocephalus varians, commonly known as the variable-headed beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Plectocephalus varians is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
